references.reason: This book is a foundational text in causal inference, providing the theoretical underpinnings for much of the work in causal AI and machine learning.

references.paper_title: Elements of Causal Inference: Foundations and Learning Algorithms
references.reason: This book offers a comprehensive overview of causal inference methods, algorithms, and applications, which is highly relevant to the paper's focus on causal dependence plots.

references.paper_title: A unified approach to interpreting model predictions
references.reason: This paper introduces the SHAP (SHapley Additive exPlanations) values, a widely-used model-agnostic method for explaining individual predictions which is compared to in this paper.

references.paper_title: Visualizing the effects of predictor variables in black box supervised learning models
references.reason: This paper introduces the ALE (Accumulated Local Effects) plots, another model-agnostic method for explaining the effects of predictor variables that this paper generalizes and compares to.

references.paper_title: Peeking inside the black box: Visualizing statistical learning with plots of individual conditional expectation
references.reason: This paper introduces ICE (Individual Conditional Expectation) curves, a model-agnostic method for explaining individual predictions that this paper generalizes and compares to.
